description: {"blocks":[{"key":"evm6d","text":"Cryo-Electron Tomography (Cryo-ET) and Cryo-Focused Ion Beam (Cryo-FIB) milling provides insight into the structure and architecture of various proteins and organelles in cells. Mammalian cells require to be thinned into sections of ~150-200nm to gain high-resolution information about the contents of the cell. Cryo-FIB milling allows us to ablate regions of cells leaving behind a thin section of cellular material called Lamella. In this protocol, we describe how to manually prepare lamellae using a dual-beam FIB/SEM microscope (Aquilos 2+ system). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"6383f","text":"Aquilos Cryo-FIB/SEM dual beam microscope","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dm5t","text":"Liquid Nitrogen ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkkso","text":"Cellular sample on an autogrid designated for milling ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"6scce","text":"Lam V, Villa E. Practical Approaches for Cryo-FIB Milling and Applications for Cellular Cryo-Electron Tomography. Methods Mol Biol. 2021;2215:49-82. doi: 10.1007/978-1-0716-0966-8_3. PMID: 33367999; PMCID: PMC8836527.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cvt3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8m4r","text":"Check the status of the high-pressure LN2 tank. If empty change it. Set the regulator valve to 80psi. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgh0e","text":"Move the stage to the Mapping position and drop SEM magnification to the lowest possible magnification. Check the focus and take an overview image and save it with a desired name. Assess the distribution of cells in SEM overview and do a rough count of mill-able cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45t6a","text":"Check hydration of cells in FIB view. Move the stage to the Milling position. Set the current to 10pA, and set it to a magnification that includes most of the center of the grid (or the majority of cells). Check focus and take snapshots and save it in a designated folder. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4v1sq","text":"Repeat for the second loaded grid if applicable. If you are happy with the grids and cell distribution, put away open grid boxes in the loading station. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nlr3","text":"For chosen grid, find focus and link focus to the stage. In the mapping position increase the magnification to 250 in the SEM view. Find a focus with the - Reduced area. Link the focus position to the stage. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hfv0","text":"In the SEM lower the magnification to 59x. Open the latest version of MAPS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"buaju","text":"Start a new project in MAPS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fibbn","text":"In MAPS select cells that you would like to mill. Add lamellae sites and rank them in order of preference. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f5r1","text":"Find the eucentric height for each lamellae site. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"366i3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1jn5q","text":"Sputter coat the grids. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu7ur","text":"Wake up the beam and move back to the Mapping position. Take a new lowest magnification overview, save the image, and note the contrast change. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"24mgd","text":"Deposit PT on the grids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75l7q","text":"Move back to the mapping position, take an overview, save the image, and note the contrast change. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9seov","text":"Go to the Milling position in xTUI and set the desired milling angle. For mammalian cells use 10-11'. Make a note of this for cryo-TEM data collection.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an7j3","text":"In MAPS, drive to eucentric position. Check focus and centering in SEM. (~1200x, 2kV) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl0r8","text":"With FIB at ~2000x at 10pA, center the same cell in FIB view with beam shift knobs and check focus. Increase the magnification to fill FOV with most of the cell. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clgve","text":"Load a rectangle pattern preset and position at 10pA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9e0o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d5fqm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9ve1k","text":"Preset parameters used: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aqqsh","text":"Width 12mm - length -  5mm","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5qa6v","text":"The separation between the two patterns - 3-4mm","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fenjc","text":"Stress relief cuts - 500nm","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mcpj","text":"Approximate milling routine: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt1g0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67k57","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d0skv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"302nb","text":"Use scan rotation to make the milling pattern and lamella parallel for more even/smoother milling.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er227","text":"Things to monitor during milling. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lfev","text":"GIS layer at the front of the lamella. When this breaks through, becomes very difficult to mill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dos48","text":"Observed transparency in SEM at 2 kV. Becomes homogenous and dark at thickness \u003c 200 nm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ngo3","text":"Repeat the above steps for all desired lamella.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arbh3","text":"Polishing: Return to each lamella and aim for \u003c10 mins of polishing for each. \n10 pA top-side only, X-width 10 um, no over/under-tilt.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"183b8","text":"Retrieve grids from the microscope and store them.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctre6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b92nk","text":"Set the flow of the heat exchanger to 10mg/s and remove the heat exchanger from the dewer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v7ki","text":"Update your notes and sample information. Update personal spreadsheets/logs with information about the session. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8jb8f","text":"Drive to the eucentric position and select calculate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1bgq","text":"Check SEM centering at medium magnification and focus accordingly ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eahp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"af8qu","text":"Tilt step of 10o, click the LEFT arrow, update SEM and recenter by double-clicking on the desired feature. Repeat until stage angle = 5o.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":135,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90na0","text":"Once centered at 5o stage tilt, click to calculate eucentric position. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":18,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48aac","text":"Repeat the above steps for each lamella site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rfol","text":"0.5 nA, 12 um X-width, 3um separation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"792fg","text":"0.3 nA, 11.5 um X-width, 1.5 um separation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dqjo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emtkf","text":"0.1 nA, 11 um X-width, 750 nm separation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2jvk","text":"50 pA, 10.5 um X-width, 400 nm separation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8356n","text":"30 pA, 10 um X-width, 200 nm separation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g10k","text":"30 pA, 0.5â€™ under-tilt, 10 um X-width","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fgdme","text":"Mill under-side from lamella back. 30 pA, 0.5â€™ over-tilt, 10 um X-width, mill top-side from lamella back.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-left","offset":0,"length":105}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b8dao","text":"Retrieve the grids intended for milling. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"66fjq","text":"Fill 4L dewer with clean liquid nitrogen (LN2) for sample loading. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"162pa","text":"Fill the heat exchanger tank with liquid nitrogen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"844b8","text":"Once filled place a heat exchanger rod into the tank. Set the flow rate to 190-210 and start cooling down the stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3slc5","text":"Prepare the loading station. Slowly add clean liquid nitrogen to the basin and wait till the LN2 equilibrates.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12nkb","text":"Load the grids of interest into the sample shuttle. Have grids oriented so that the milling notch is facing upwards.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsf7o","text":"Once loaded, top-up LN2 in the loading station and maintain to keep the open grid box cold. Leave the base lid on. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcuc5","text":"Close the shuttle and place it in the loading position. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4oen","text":"Insert the shuttle into the microscope using the sample transfer rod. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn6j3","text":"On the microscope set the scan rotation to 180o for both SEM and FIB view. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":46,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnuau","text":"Create a directory on your computer to save the images from the session. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cadcb","text":"Take a quick SEM snapshot with MAPS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfbm5","text":"Add a 4x4 tileset and position it over the middle of the snapshot. Set the focus to Fixed and click RUN. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"r8vg","text":"Click on Prepare for the sputtering button. Choose conditions you would like to use for sputtering (i.e. 30mA, 0.1mbar, 30 sec). Press Run and wait. Once done recover the system. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7od8","text":" Move to the deposition position for the chosen grid. Click on the Cryo-TEM preparation tab in xTUI. Under the Cryo-GIS deposition tab, enter the grid number and set the desired time for the deposition. (e.g. 60 seconds). Click Start to start deposition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Cryo-FIB Milling protocol for mammalian cells
title_html: Cryo-FIB Milling protocol for mammalian cells
